content: >http://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/24/world/middleeast/24sunni.html?pagewanted=1&_r=2&ref=world General Petraeus schem of hiring insurgents to fight AQ is starting to wear thin. The government of Iraq which has had the responsibility passed over to them, have been having administrative difficulty in getting the 'Sons of Iraq' paid their monthly stipend. Guys who formerly might have taken AQ's $50 for planting a bomb, aren't getting anything for their service to Iraq. It's a good thing AQ has been wiped out and isn't offering cash rewards any more.
reply: >http://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/24/world/middleeast/24sunni.html?pagewanted=1&_r=2&ref=world General Petraeus schem of hiring insurgents to fight AQ is starting to wear thin. Guys who formerly might have taken AQ's $50 for planting a bomb, aren't getting anything for their service to Iraq. It's a good thing AQ has been wiped out and isn't offering cash rewards any more.
title: Pay for Peace Scheme Fraying
